WAS LOCATED NEAR LATITUDE 11.5 NORTH...LONGITUDE  27.0 WEST.  THIS
POSITION IS IN THE FAR EASTERN TROPICAL ATLANTIC OCEAN ABOUT 300
MILES...480 KM...SOUTH-SOUTHWEST OF THE CAPE VERDE ISLANDS.

AND THIS MOTION IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY.
 
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS ARE NEAR  30 MPH... 45 KM/HR...WITH HIGHER
GUSTS.  SLOW STRENGTHENING IS FORECAST DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS.
 
ESTIMATED MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE IS 1008 MB...29.77 INCHES.

TOWARD...WEST NEAR 23 MPH.  MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS... 30 MPH. 
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1008 MB.

5 PM AST.

TROPICAL STORM ALEX ADVISORY NUMBER   7
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MIAMI FL
11 PM AST TUE JUL 28 1998
 
...FIRST TROPICAL STORM OF SEASON FORMS OVER CENTRAL TROPICAL
ATLANTIC...

SATELLITE PICTURES INDICATE THAT TROPICAL DEPRESSION ONE HAS
STRENGTHENED OVER THE PAST FEW HOURS...AND IS NOW TROPICAL STORM
ALEX.  AT 11 PM AST...0300Z...THE CENTER OF THE TROPICAL STORM
WAS LOCATED NEAR LATITUDE 13.8 NORTH...LONGITUDE  37.8 WEST
OR ABOUT 1425 MILES...2300 KM...EAST OF THE LESSER ANTILLES.
 
ALEX IS MOVING TOWARD THE WEST NEAR 21 MPH...33 KM/HR.  A GRADUAL
TURN TOWARD THE WEST-NORTHWEST AND SLOWER PACE IS EXPECTED BY LATE
WEDNESDAY.
 
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS ARE ESTIMATED NEAR  40 MPH... 65
KM/HR...WITH HIGHER GUSTS.  SOME STRENGTHENING IS FORECAST DURING
THE NEXT 24 HOURS.
 
TROPICAL STORM FORCE WINDS EXTEND OUTWARD UP TO 115 MILES...185 KM
FROM THE CENTER.
 
ESTIMATED MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE IS 1005 MB...29.68 INCHES.
 
THE NEXT ADVISORY WILL BE ISSUED BY THE NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER AT
5 AM AST...WEDNESDAY.
 
RAPPAPORT

FOUND UNDER AFOS HEADER MIASPFAT1 AND WMO HEADER WTNT71 KNHC.

...ALEX HAS DISSIPATED...

WEAK TROUGH LOCATED A FEW HUNDRED MILES NORTHEAST OF THE NORTHERN
LEEWARD ISLANDS...ACCOMPANIED BY A FEW SHOWERS AND LOCALLY GUSTY
WINDS.

CENTER ON ALEX...UNLESS REGENERATION OCCURS.
